Description: Calcite drill-core, a by-product of vessel manufacture, cylinder-shaped with a kind of flange around one end, partly broken. The other end is flat and also partly broken.
Curator's comments: On "drill-cores from tubular drillings", "alabaster, obsidian, syenite, basalt & jasper", see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70. 23832 is an "alabaster" one. See other drill-cores from the site, calcite: London, BM, EA 23833, London, PM, UC 72458 (4 items); Boston, MFA, RES 87.116-117 (2 items); jasper: Boston, MFA, RE 87.114-115 (2 items); syenite: Boston , MFA, 87.118. See also London, BM, EA 18475, 18476, 18477, 18478 and 18480, also very probably from Tell Dafana.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.88, p.188, pl.30)
